pr_title: MicroProfile Config Value Resolver API POC

timeline.message: Initial implementation of ConfigValueResolver and some tests (needs more tests)
adds more unit tests for ConfigValueResolver
fixes CDI provider behaviour for missing properties in connection with defaults
adds tests for arrays and TTL
adds copyright headers, extracts ArrayConverter to top level class

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick - wouldn't immutable empty collections work better as default?
timeline.author: pdudits

replies.bodyText: Maybe - did not want to change the previous behaviour.
replies.author: jbee

timeline.bodyText:
I don't agree. There's no universal rule when this makes sense and when it doesn't. And there are too many options on how things can be handled.
There is large ommision in the TCK not giving out enough negative testcases, and taskcases that would clean confusion around trimming, empty values and so forth. But I think current wording does not give us the freedom to do more things in the stardard converter. There are tests for primitive converters, which do expect IllegalArgumentException to be thrown, just as javadoc of Converter  suggests.
I see that this behavior is expected in realm classes above, but I think it would be more secure to just extend your nice resolver API, where collection methods would have methods to specify:

To trim value before converting
To ignore some parsing errors (or all parsing errors returning empty collection)
To allow empty values (as nulls), to skip them, or to throw errors.
